abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (S)

block.p: * Toshiba America Consumer Products, Wayne, N.J., to Towne Silverstein Rotter, New York, to handle its strategic, creative and media account, which had been at Ferrell Calvillo Communications, New York. Spending was estimated at $15 million. * Reelshort.com, Los Angeles and New York, to FourFront, New York, as the first agency of record to handle the account of the entertainment Web site. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

* Toshiba America Consumer Products, Wayne, N.J., to Towne Silverstein Rotter, New York, to handle its strategic, creative and media account, which had been at Ferrell Calvillo Communications, New York. Spending was estimated at $15 million. * Reelshort.com, Los Angeles and New York, to FourFront, New York, as the first agency of record to handle the account of the entertainment Web site. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

* ADC Telecommunications, Minneapolis, which offers broadband services, to Campbell Mithun, Minneapolis, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its account, which had been at Periscope Marketing Communications, Minneapolis. Billings were estimated at $10 million. * Charles Schwab & Co., San Francisco, to Halloran Robertson & Associates, San Jose, Calif., to handle the account of its Advisor Source customer consulting service, which had been at Digitas, Boston. Billings were estimated at $5 million. * Muse Cordero Chen & Partners, Los Angeles, part of Muse Creative Holdings, was named the first agency to handle ethnic marketing for two accounts, with combined billings estimated at $3 million to $5 million: Health Net, Woodland Hills, Calif., part of Foundation Health Systems, and Sempra Energy, San Diego. * National Peanut Board, Atlanta, to the Atlanta office of Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, part of the WPP Group, for its first domestic advertising campaign. Billings were estimated at $3 million for a one-year contract. * Zilo Networks, New York, a provider of Web content and offline programming, to Dweck, New York, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $3 million.

THE MEDIA BUSINESS: ADVERTISING -- ADDENDA Correction: September 16, 2000, Saturday An entry in the Addenda listing of the Media Business page on Tuesday about Charles Schwab & Company's selection of Halloran Robertson & Associates in San Jose, Calif., to handle an assignment for its Advisor Source customer consulting service misidentified the agency that had the role previously. It was the San Francisco office of Brann Worldwide, part of Snyder Communications (which is being acquired by Havas Advertising), not Digitas in Boston.
